page.title: 05 Greenhill Bower
page.content: Every year there is a procession held in Lichfield called the Greenhill Bower. It was originally held for men of Lichfield to show their armour and weapons. At the end of the day they had fun at the fair. Nowadays, the Bower is in three parts, the procession, the fair and the horse show. The procession is very exciting. It is made up of lots of floats, which are decorated by local people. The leading float carries the Bower Queen and her attendants, the Bower Prince and Princess. For the last four years the Bower Princess has come from our school. A big fair comes with stalls and rides and some of the central streets are closed to hold it. The horse show is made up of show and jumping classes.
